TopicTitle: Mobile layout might be broken for 2 years

Articles.Content:
So... the new forums were up sometime in December 2015 and it's been an year... Still, the mobile layout is messed up.

For example, I can't use the pagination (and some items are out of place), and the thread view sucks (author info occupies half screen, thread content occupies the other half)

EDIT: the top right menu is almost unaccessible due to the button being too small.

Can we, mobile users, get a late Christmas gift that fixes those issues? 

 

 

Edited December 26, 2016 by RockyTV

On 12/25/2016 at 10:13 PM, RockyTV said:

So... the new forums were up sometime in December 2015 and it's been an year... Still, the mobile layout is messed up.

There is no separate mobile layout, the layout of the main site adjusts on the fly based on window width and DPI settings.

On 12/25/2016 at 10:13 PM, RockyTV said:

For example, I can't use the pagination (and some items are out of place),

Pagination is working fine here, with functional Next, Previous, First, and Last buttons. Do you have a specific issue with it?

On 12/25/2016 at 10:13 PM, RockyTV said:

and the thread view sucks (author info occupies half screen, thread content occupies the other half)

Author info is compressed and signatures are omitted altogether, not sure exactly what you'd prefer here to make it "suck" less. Though we don't exactly have a lot of control over that layout.

On 12/25/2016 at 10:13 PM, RockyTV said:

EDIT: the top right menu is almost unaccessible due to the button being too small. 

This makes me think you've adjusted your mobile browser's DPI to make it more desktop-like (some have a setting that attempts to trick the browser into thinking it's closer to a destop DPI).
